Colleges Other Than the Graduate School Cornell University offers many graduate and professional degrees in addition to the those offered by the Graduate School . Graduate-level degrees outside of the Graduate School are listed below by their respective college or school. These degrees are not administered by the Graduate School and instead are directly administered and supported by the following schools: Bowers College of Computing and Information Science Dual M.S. Connective Media Concentration at Cornell Tech (Jacobs Technion-Cornell Dual Master of Science Degrees) Dual M.S. Health Tech Concentration at Cornell Tech (Jacobs Technion-Cornell Dual Master of Science Degrees) Dual M.S. Urban Tech Concentration at Cornell Tech (Jacobs Technion-Cornell Dual Master of Science Degrees) M.Eng. Computer Science at Cornell Tech (Master of Engineering) Brooks School of Public Policy M.H.A. Land Acknowledgement Cornell University is located on the traditional homelands of the Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ (the Cayuga Nation). The Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ are members of the Hodinǫ̱hsǫ́:nih Confederacy, an alliance of six sovereign Nations with a historic and contemporary presence on this land. The Confederacy precedes the establishment of Cornell University, New York state, and the United States of America. We acknowledge the painful history of Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ dispossession, and honor the ongoing connection of Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ people, past and present, to these lands and waters. This land acknowledgment has been reviewed and approved by the traditional Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ leadership.
